billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION

title: Requires inmates to make medical co-payments
summary: Requires inmates in state correctional facilities to make medical co-payments of seven dollars upon receipt of medical treatment; provides that an inmate shall not be refused treatment for lack of ability to pay co-payment charges; directs all moneys collected to be made available for the operation of such correctional facility.

       AN  ACT to amend the correction law, in relation to requiring inmates to

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-

    1    Section  1.  The correction law is amended by adding a new section 607
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 607. MEDICAL TREATMENT CO-PAYMENT. 1. AN INMATE OF AN INSTITUTION OF
    4  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL MAKE A MEDICAL CO-PAYMENT IN THE  AMOUNT  OF  SEVEN
    5  DOLLARS UPON RECEIPT OF MEDICAL TREATMENT.
    6    2.  EACH INMATE SHALL BE REQUIRED TO SIGN A LOG DOCUMENTING THE SCHED-
    7  ULED TIME OF VISIT,  INMATE  NAME  AND  ID  NUMBER  AND  DESCRIPTION  OF
    8  COMPLAINT.
    9    3.  EACH  MEDICAL  CO-PAYMENT SHALL BE POSTED TO THE INMATES' ACCOUNTS
   10  EITHER AS MEDICAL OR DENTAL CHARGES TO  FACILITATE  RESPONSE  TO  INMATE
   11  QUERIES.
   12    4.  EACH  INMATE SHALL BE SENT AN ACCOUNT STATEMENT AT THE END OF EACH
   13  MONTH SHOWING ALL CREDITS AND DEBITS AGAINST THE ACCOUNT AND  ACCOMPANY-
   14  ING EXPLANATIONS.
   15    5. SHOULD AN INMATE NOT HAVE SUFFICIENT FUNDS IN HIS OR HER ACCOUNT TO
   16  COVER  THE  CHARGES,  THEN  HIS  OR  HER ACCOUNT SHALL BE FROZEN PENDING
   17  RECEIPT OF FUNDS SUFFICIENT TO SATISFY HIS OR HER OBLIGATION.
   18    6. AN INMATE SHALL NOT BE REFUSED TREATMENT FOR LACK OF ABILITY TO PAY

   20  WHEN THE VISIT LOG IS PROCESSED.

   23  WAS  AGREED TO BY THE FEDERAL AGENCY. SUBSEQUENTLY FEDERAL BOARDERS WILL
